attributes.action: make general election polling day a bank holiday
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Since 1950 the percentage of registered voters who have cast a ballot in a general election has fallen from almost 85% to just over 60%. Although there was a small increase in 2005, this is still far short of producing a truly democratic result. By making polling day a bank holiday it would raise the profile of the election and encourage otherwise disenfranchised voters to participate, increasing turnout and providing a stronger mandate to the new government.
